players.name: AT&T
players.role: Largest US telecom by revenue operating nationwide wireless, fiber, and enterprise networks

players.name: Verizon
players.role: Leading US wireless carrier known for network quality with growing 5G and fiber deployments

players.name: T-Mobile
players.role: Fastest-growing US wireless carrier with the largest 5G network by coverage area

players.name: Deutsche Telekom
players.role: Europe's largest telecom operator and majority owner of T-Mobile US

stages.name: Service Delivery
stages.description: Packaging and delivering connectivity services including mobile plans, broadband internet, enterprise networking, and managed services to customers.

players.name: Comcast (Xfinity)
players.role: Largest US broadband provider delivering internet, TV, and phone services via cable and fiber

players.name: Charter (Spectrum)
players.role: Second-largest US cable operator providing broadband, TV, and mobile services

players.name: T-Mobile
players.role: Consumer wireless and fixed wireless home internet services to 120+ million customers

players.name: Amdocs
players.role: Leading BSS/OSS vendor providing billing, CRM, and service delivery software to global carriers

stages.name: End Users
stages.description: Consumer, enterprise, and IoT customers who use telecommunications services for voice, data, video, and connected device connectivity.

players.name: Apple
players.role: iPhone is the single largest driver of wireless subscriber upgrades and data consumption

players.name: Samsung Electronics
players.role: Second-largest smartphone manufacturer driving wireless plan adoption globally

players.name: Zoom Video Communications
players.role: Major consumer of telecom bandwidth for video conferencing used by millions of businesses

players.name: Amazon (Ring/Alexa)
players.role: IoT devices and smart home products driving consumer broadband demand and connected device growth

stages.name: Spectrum Licensing
stages.description: Acquisition of radio frequency spectrum through government auctions and regulatory processes, the foundational scarce resource for 5G wireless networks.

players.name: T-Mobile
players.role: Acquired the largest mid-band 5G spectrum holdings in the US through Sprint merger and auctions

players.name: AT&T
players.role: Holds extensive low-band, mid-band, and C-band spectrum licenses for 5G deployment

players.name: Verizon
players.role: Invested $45B+ in C-band and mmWave spectrum to power its 5G Ultra Wideband network

players.name: Dish Network
players.role: Holds significant spectrum licenses and is building the first greenfield 5G Open RAN network in the US

stages.name: RAN Equipment
stages.description: Manufacturing and deployment of 5G radio access network equipment including massive MIMO antennas, small cells, and Open RAN components.

players.name: Ericsson
players.role: Leading 5G RAN supplier with massive MIMO radios deployed across all major global carriers

players.name: Nokia
players.role: Major 5G RAN vendor with AirScale platform serving carriers in the US, Europe, and Asia

players.name: Samsung Networks
players.role: Gained significant US 5G RAN market share with Verizon and other carrier deployments

players.name: Mavenir
players.role: Leading Open RAN software vendor enabling disaggregated 5G network architectures

stages.name: Core Network
stages.description: 5G standalone core network software providing network functions like authentication, session management, and network slicing in cloud-native architecture.

players.name: Ericsson
players.role: Provides cloud-native 5G core network software with dual-mode 4G/5G capabilities

players.name: Nokia
players.role: Offers 5G core network solutions with advanced network slicing and automation capabilities

players.name: Cisco Systems
players.role: Provides 5G packet core, routing, and security infrastructure for carrier core networks

players.name: Affirmed Networks (Microsoft)
players.role: Cloud-native mobile core network acquired by Microsoft for Azure-based 5G core deployments

stages.name: Edge Computing
stages.description: Multi-access edge computing (MEC) infrastructure deployed at cell tower sites and carrier facilities to enable ultra-low-latency 5G applications.

players.name: Amazon (AWS Wavelength)
players.role: Deploys AWS compute at carrier edge locations for ultra-low-latency 5G application hosting

players.name: Microsoft (Azure Edge Zones)
players.role: Provides Azure compute at 5G network edge for enterprise and carrier applications

players.name: Dell Technologies
players.role: Provides edge server hardware and solutions for MEC deployments at 5G cell sites

players.name: Vapor IO
players.role: Builds edge data center infrastructure at the base of cell towers for 5G edge applications

stages.name: Network Deployment
stages.description: Physical construction and installation of 5G infrastructure including tower builds, small cell deployment, fiber backhaul, and network commissioning.

players.name: MasTec
players.role: Largest US telecom infrastructure contractor building 5G towers and fiber for major carriers

players.name: Dycom Industries
players.role: Specialty contractor installing fiber backhaul and wireless infrastructure for 5G deployments

players.name: Crown Castle
players.role: Deploys small cells and fiber infrastructure critical for densified 5G urban networks

players.name: Quanta Services
players.role: Major infrastructure contractor deploying 5G tower builds and fiber networks nationwide

stages.name: Enterprise & Consumer Services
stages.description: 5G-enabled products and services including enhanced mobile broadband, fixed wireless access, private 5G networks, and IoT connectivity.

players.name: T-Mobile
players.role: Leads in 5G consumer adoption and fixed wireless home internet using its extensive mid-band network

players.name: Verizon (Business)
players.role: Sells private 5G networks and mobile edge compute solutions to enterprise customers

players.name: AT&T (Business)
players.role: Deploys private 5G and FirstNet public safety networks for enterprise and government customers

players.name: Qualcomm
players.role: Provides Snapdragon 5G modems and platforms enabling 5G in smartphones, PCs, and IoT devices
